Deficiency Narrative: It was observed during the walk through  multiple beds did not have mattress covers on mattresses, that were not waterproof.
Correction Narrative: On 02/03, Inspector received compliance photos which reflected the operation had put mattress covers on the bed.

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of four vehicles used to transport children had expired inspection stickers. Two vehicle's inspection stickers expired in May 2024 and the third expired in September 2024.
Correction Narrative: Administrator, Mr. Jeffery Edmonds, sent pictures of all three vehicles which included their license plate numbers. The pictures reflected that all three vehicles had up to date inspection stickers.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of two child files reviewed reflected it did not include operation policies on their religious program and practices as well as gifts.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided a copy of child rights which will include notification of Paradigms policies on religious program and practices for clients and parents' signature. The copy will also be placed in the client's workbook for review at any time and it will be reviewed during client's orientation at admission.

Deficiency Narrative: Observation during walkthrough of operation revealed fire extinguishers in the three homes and the school to have been last inspected December 2022.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided documentation of company inspecting fire extinguishers on 04/17/2024.  There will be fire extinguisher monthly audits added to their Safety Protocol monthly walk through and auditing updates. The Administrator, Mr. Jeff Edmonds, will be listed as the responsible party for all Safety Protocol audits.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation does not have goals or expectations from the parent in their current admission procedure/documentation.
Child files reviewed did not indicate any known contraindications to the use of restraints during their pre or post admission documentation.
Staff file reviewed indicated CPR/First Aid was completed after 90 days of employment and had access to children in care.
Correction Narrative: On 9/11/23 an email was received stating that, "All current employee files have been updated to meet this minimum standard. It has also been implemented in Human Resources policy that CPR certification be assigned or documented on the employeeÂ’s first day of employment with Paradigm Treatment Centers."

Deficiency Narrative: Placement agreement currently in place did not indicate the reason and length of time when child is placed at the operation.
Child in care placed at the operation for 55 days with no TB test.
Correction Narrative: On 9/11/23 an email was received stating that, "Admission assessment and nurse screening assessment has been updated to provide tuberculosis (TB) screening and/or provide a TB skin test at admissions. The EHR (electronic health record) of our agency has also been updated to include a medical check list for all new admissions to ensure a TB screening has been provided to each client.

Deficiency Narrative: Two child records reviewed were missing items in children's rights.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided the updated child rights form and reflected all of the necessary requirements for that section.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple doors leading to the swimming pool do not have a lock.
Correction Narrative:
On 6/12/23 email was sent with photos of doors leading to pool areas with a padlock and uploaded into SharePoint.
On 7/14/23 An in-person inspection was conducted and doors leading to the pool area were all inspected to have padlocks or custom locks in place.

Deficiency Narrative: When requesting drug tests not all staff was drug tested. HR is allowing staff to set up dates to get drug tested by today and get drug tested by the end of June.
Correction Narrative:
On 6/29/23 an email was sent with a list of all current staff totaling to 36 current staff, all testing negative, with 1 pending result and 2 who have yet conducted the screening due to medical leave and will do so upon arriving back to the facility as per policy.
7/14/23 An in-person inspection was conducted and facility had all current staff working at the facility drug tested and with a negative on their finding result.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 out of 2 documents reviewed showed medications for clients were taken past the hour scheduled to be taken.
Correction Narrative:
On 7/3/23 email was sent stating that their policy will now require children to wake up at regular time even on the weekends to take their medication on time. Schedule changes with staff have been made to comply with minimum standard. 
7/14/23 An in-person inspection was conducted and electronic medication log of a pervious resident and current resident were reviewed to verify that within the last 2 weeks they have been taking their medication within the one hour of preparation.

Deficiency Narrative: 4 out of 4 records reviewed contained no section for addtional information for child runaways.
Correction Narrative: 4 out of 4 records reviewed contained no section for addtional information for child runaways.

Deficiency Narrative: New director not added into controlling persons withing 24hrs of DOH.
4 out of 4 incident reports reviewed did not contain a resolution section.
Correction Narrative: 4 out of 4 incident reports reviewed did not contain a resolution section.

Deficiency Narrative: 1 out of 2 records reviewed contained no notarized affidavit.
Correction Narrative: 1 out of 2 records reviewed contained no notarized affidavit.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not include the address, telephone number, or relationship of the person to whom the child was discharged to on the discharge summary.
Correction Narrative: The operation has updated their electronic health record to request this information specifically name, relationship to individual, address and telephone number.

Deficiency Narrative: 4 out of 4 records did not have the immunization record documented in the resident's record.
Correction Narrative:
On 3/21/23 Ms. Ware sent an email with the following: 

1.	Our Admissions Team will be sending parents the attached assessment to complete prior to admissions (stored in EMR)
a.	This will identify neonatal history and dates of immunizations, dental, hearing, vision and medical exams
2.	Our Admissions Team will then be reviewing, collecting, & uploading the following documents (documentation for immunizations, dental, hearing, vision and medical exams) that align with the attached
3.	If a client does not have said exams prior to intake, our Admissions Team will inform our Head Nurse, who will make plans with the families to complete within first week of admissions

A test document was also uploaded to SharePoint showing all medical documentation.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not include the name or information of the person the child was discharged to on the discharge summary.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided an updated copy of their discharge summary template including a section to list who the client will be discharged to and to include the name and contact information of this person.

Deficiency Narrative: Several fire extinguishers were observed to have low pressure or in the red, no documentation of service date, and one fire extinguisher was last serviced in October 2018,
Correction Narrative: On 12/19/22, an email was received from the operation with several photos of fire extinguishers indicating the fire extinguishers were inspected in December 2022 and fire extinguisher pressure for the fire extinguishers are in green/does not need to be recharged. Tags indicate the fire extinguishers are new. Photos uploaded into SharePoint digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: Four employees do not have cleared fingerprint results from the CBCU and have began employment.  Three of four of the employees work directly with the children. One of four of the staff's background checks is showing as inactive in CLASS.
Correction Narrative: Email received on 01/03/23 stating that the (3) staff in question have been cleared. From here on out all staff will be required to complete Background checks before starting employment.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation continued to care for a teenager in care who has history of trauma related to human trafficking as documented in the child's Biopsychosocial Assessment, however the operation doesn't provide this service.
Correction Narrative: The operation has determined that if information comes out before admission that a child has been found to be outside of their licensing requirements, they will look for a different placement for the child or seek assistance with an outside contract service to meet the need of the child and inform DFPS agency. If they find out information after admission of the child, they will seek assistance to meet the needs of child and will inform DFPS agency for compliance. They reported they will comply with this standard as of 2/03/2023. On 2/1/23, it was also discussed by phone with the operation Administrator and Executive Director that in certain situations where the operation is not able to meet a standard, then they may submit a variance if needed temporarily and licensing would either approve or deny it based on the child's best interest and other requirements.

Deficiency Narrative:
During the investigation, it was found that a direct care staff administered a prescription medication to a teenager in care that was requested by the child, but this medication was not supposed to be administered to this child because there was no health care professional order for the prescription medication. There were no reported injuries, adverse actions or drug reactions for the child that would have caused harm.

It was also found that children in care have been administered two different as needed prescription medications from the same prescription bottle prescribed to the operation as a whole.
Correction Narrative: The operation reported they have consulted with their contracted psychiatrist that all prescribed meds will only be given to the child that is prescribed that individual medication and labeled accordingly for specific child. This standard will be complied by 2/03/2023. The staff involved in the incident who gave unprescribed medication has gone through re-training on med pass as of 1/15/2023 and will continue to receive training.

Deficiency Narrative: One staff who has a Provisional background check with conditions was reported to have been working at the operation with direct access to children in care and administering medications to children in care, this staff was working at the operation on 1/27/23.
Correction Narrative:
On 2/1/23, in speaking with the operation by phone the Administrator reported they will make sure moving forward they will ensure background checks are properly run. The Administrator reported for the direct care staff with the Provisional background check they will ensure conditions are followed and if any other staff are hired w/ provisional background checks, then they will make sure they follow all conditions. The Administrator and Executive Director will ensure compliance.

Additionally, on 2/6/23, the operation reported the direct care staff has sent in documents from Colorado to clear their background check and the person within the background company stated this will clear the provision and will enter it ASAP but that they were swamped since the closure last week due to severe weather.

As of 2/7/23, the direct care staff's provisional background check cleared and is now without any provisions.

Deficiency Narrative:
During the investigation, it was found that one (1) staff who was reported to be an employee of the operation has a pending fingerprint background check but has been working at the operation on an as needed basis as a nurse.

Another staff who was reported to be a personal trainer on campus for the children in care who is considered a volunteer of the operation did not have a background check.
Correction Narrative:
On 2/1/23, in speaking with the operation by phone the Administrator reported they will make sure to run the background check for the personal trainer and moving forward they will ensure any other background checks are properly run. The Administrator reported the "as needed" Nurse will not be working until cleared. The Administrator and Executive Director will ensure compliance.

Additionally, on 2/6/23, the operation reported through email that the nurse is waiting on fingerprints as they were closed through the winter storm last week. This Nurse will not work until the background check has completely cleared and they reported the personal trainer background check has been submitted and they are awaiting results.

As of 2/7/23, the PRN Nurse's fingerprints cleared and on 1/30/23, the contract Personal Trainer's background check was submitted and Eligible as of 2/24/23.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was able to gain access to the operation's medication storage area and obtain another child's prescription medication without any staff witnessing the incident.
Correction Narrative: A child in care was able to gain access to the operation's medication storage area and obtain another child's prescription medication without any staff witnessing the incident.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was able to obtain another child's prescription medication due to the medication storage area being left open and unlocked and unattended by staff.
Correction Narrative: A child in care was able to obtain another child's prescription medication due to the medication storage area being left open and unlocked and unattended by staff.

Deficiency Narrative: 1 out of 4 staff records reviewed was missing their affidavit in their file.
Correction Narrative: Email received on 10/5/22 with proof of completed employee's affidavit.

Deficiency Narrative: Sanitation Inspection was not provided.
Correction Narrative: On 10/20/22 an email was sent out with the sanitation inspection stating that it PASSED. Uploaded document into digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: Three mattresses were missing the cover.
Fire Inspection was not provided.
Correction Narrative: On 10/25/22 email was received from the fire department a letter confirming that the certificates that the facilities have are to be used as their formal PASS for the fire inspection. Uploaded into digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: The 2 doors leading to the water heater were not locked. 1 out of 2 doors that contain electrical wires were not locked.
Correction Narrative: Email received on 10/5/22 from operation with a picture showing a lock was placed on door so that children could not access the water heater and electrical wires.

Deficiency Narrative: Bedroom facing the pool has a metal structure that can be hazardous for a child if they fall over the balcony.
Correction Narrative: Email was received on 10/5/22 from operation with 2 photos showing that the metal structure by the balcony was removed.

Deficiency Narrative: Copy of Clinical Social Worker License not in personnel record.
Correction Narrative: On 10/5/22 email was received with proof of employee's Clinical Social Worker license.
